venice.lib.networkIIO

Class IIONamespaceBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.lib.networkIIO.IIONamespaceBuilder

  • public class IIONamespaceBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates all necessary objects for an InstantIO namespace, so namespaces and slots can easily be used without accessing the instantreality.jar directly.

    Usually the following methods are important:

    prepareNamespace to activate the InstantIO communication. For a simple logger application the namespace can be just "".

    setSlotFlags to determine if the application wants to send or to receive (sending: new SlotFlags(true, false), receiving: new SlotFlags(false, true)).

    initializeInSlots for receiving or initializeOutSlots for sending.

    setMasterInSlotListener for registering a receiving listener (only for sending data).

    To write data to outslots, use write.

    To send to/receive from outside of the computer, increase the TTL with setMulticastTTL.

    • Method Detail

      • prepareNamespace

        public static void prepareNamespace(java.lang.String label)
        An application has to use this method to tell venice.lib what namespaces are to be created. The method setSlotFlags can be used to demand a read-only or write-only configuration, see there for more details.
        The NetworkNode will automatically be created on the first use.
        Parameters:
        label - label of the demanded namespaces, can be empty, but not null

      • setSlotFlags

        public static void setSlotFlags(SlotFlags newSlotFlags)
        Sets the flags for importing and exporting slots for the network node.
        Parameters:
        newSlotFlags - new settings for the slot flags

      • getSlotFlags

        public static SlotFlags getSlotFlags()
        Returns the actual setting of the slot flags.

      • initializeOutSlots

        @Deprecated
public static void initializeOutSlots(AbstractSlot[] predefinedSlots)
        Deprecated. There are some good reasons for not using primitive arrays in interfacing methods, so this is replaced by an ArrayList-version.
        Creates Outslots for writing data into instantIO network using predefined slots, and activates the 'predefined'-mode (instead of dynamic slot creation). If predefined slots are given (not null and not empty) only those slots will be created. Data send to non-predefined slots will be ignored. If no slots are predefined, outslot will be created dynamically. It will also create namespaces.
        Parameters:
        predefinedSlots - An array with predefined slots; if empty or null slots will be created dynamically.

      • initializeOutSlots

        public static void initializeOutSlots(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractSlot> predefinedSlots)
        Creates Outslots for writing data into instantIO network using predefined slots, and activates the 'predefined'-mode (instead of dynamic slot creation).

        If predefined slots are given (not null and not empty) only those slots will be created. Data send to non-predefined slots will be ignored. If no slots are predefined, outslot will be created dynamically. It will also create namespaces.

        Parameters:
        predefinedSlots - An ArrayList with predefined slots; if empty or null slots will be created dynamically.

      • createInitValue

        public static java.lang.Object createInitValue(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Creates an initialization value for the given type (of an out-slot).
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the out-slot
        Returns:
        an initialization value of appropriate type

      • initializeInSlots

        @Deprecated
public static void initializeInSlots(AbstractSlot[] predefinedSlots)
        Deprecated. There are some good reasons for not using primitive arrays in interfacing methods, so this is replaced by an ArrayList-version.
        Initializes in-slots. If predefined slots are given, then only those slots are created. Otherwise dynamic slot creation is used.
        Parameters:
        predefinedSlots - array with abstract slot definitions or null

      • initializeInSlots

        public static void initializeInSlots(java.util.ArrayList<AbstractSlot> predefinedSlots)
        Initializes in-slots. If predefined slots are given, then only those slots are created. Otherwise dynamic slot creation is used.
        Parameters:
        predefinedSlots - array with abstract slot definitions or null

      • write

        public static boolean write(java.lang.String outSlotLabel,
            java.lang.Object value,
            java.lang.String nmspcLbl)
        Writes data to the OutSlot with the given label. If there is no OutSlot with this label, the data will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        outSlotLabel - Label of the OutSlot where the data has to be written
        value - The data to be written
        Returns:
        true if the data could be written to the outslot, otherwise false

      • concatNamespaceAndLabel

        public static java.lang.String concatNamespaceAndLabel(java.lang.String namespace,
                                       java.lang.String label)
        Concatenates labels of a namespace and a slot, using the format namespace/label. If the namespace is null or empty, then only the label will be returned (without the slash).
        Parameters:
        namespace - The label of a namespace, or null
        label - The label of a slot
        Returns:
        Concatenation of the namespace and the label

      • getMulticastAddress

        public static java.lang.String getMulticastAddress()
        Returns the multicast address that is used by InstantIO network operations. It is returned as a String representation (i.e. "224.21.12.68").
        Returns:
        multicast address for InstantIO

      • setMulticastAddress

        public static void setMulticastAddress(java.lang.String multicastAddress)
        Sets the multicast address for the use with InstantIO network operations. It has to be given as a String, like "224.21.12.68".
        Parameters:
        multicastAddress - String representation of a multicast address

      • getMulticastPort

        public static int getMulticastPort()
        Returns the actual used multicast port that is used by InstantIO network operations.
        Returns:
        port for multicast

      • setMulticastPort

        public static void setMulticastPort(int multicastPort)
        Sets the multicast port for InstantIO network operations.
        Parameters:
        multicastPort - port for multicast

      • setMulticastTTL

        public static void setMulticastTTL(int ttl)
        Sets the time-to-live (TTL) for multicast. The TTL is decreased by every router, that the data passes. Data with TTL 0 will not be send any further. For sending to/receiving from localhost only, set TTL to 0. To increase the range, increase the TTL. The exact behavior depends on the network and internet protocols.
        Parameters:
        ttl - time-to-live for multicast

      • getMulticastTTL

        public static int getMulticastTTL()
        Gets the time-to-live (TTL) for multicast.
        Returns:
        time-to-live for multicast

      • setUnicastPort

        public static void setUnicastPort(int newUnicastPort)
        Set a port for unicast. If set to zero, no port is used.
        Parameters:
        newUnicastPort - port number or 0 to deactivate

      • setUnicastAddress

        public static void setUnicastAddress(java.lang.String newUnicastAddress)
        Set an address for unicast. If set to null, no address is used.
        Parameters:
        newUnicastAddress - IP address or null

      • setUnicastServers

        public static void setUnicastServers(java.lang.String newUnicastServers)
        Give a list of unicast servers or null.
        Parameters:
        newUnicastServers - String with a list of unicast servers, or null

      • setPrefix

        public static void setPrefix(java.lang.String nodePrefix)
        Sets a prefix that gets added to every namespace. The placeholder for slot-label is {SlotLabel}, which is also the default.
        Parameters:
        nodePrefix - String to be used as prefix for all namespaces

      • getInSlotMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,org.instantreality.InstantIO.InSlot> getInSlotMap()
        A map of all created inslots. Normally this should not be used by an application, because it violates the abstraction layer. But if an application needs direct access to org.instantreality.InstantIO.InSlot objects, this is the method to use.
        Returns:
        map of all created InSlots

      • setMasterInSlotListener

        public static void setMasterInSlotListener(AbstractSlotListener inSlotListener)
        Sets the listener that gets notified when new data comes in. This is the usual connection between venice.lib and an application that wants to receive data from network.
        Parameters:
        inSlotListener - an object that implements the AbstractSlotListener interface
        See Also:
        AbstractSlotListener

      • getMasterInSlotListener

        public static AbstractSlotListener getMasterInSlotListener()
        Returns the listener that is registered to receive new data.
        Returns:
        AbstractSlotListener that is registered to receive new data
        See Also:
        AbstractSlotListener

      • setXioCodesFilename

        public static void setXioCodesFilename(java.lang.String filename)
        Set the name of a file with mapping information about xio codes and types.

        One of the default xio codes is sfstring and it is by default mapped to String. If new xio codes are needed, or if they have to be mapped to other types, a xio code file ist needed.

        Example file 1:
        <codes>
        <def class="java.lang.String" code="sfstring"/>
        </codes>

        Example file 2:
        <codes>
        <def class="java.lang.String" code="sfstring"/>
        <def class="[Ljava.lang.String;" code="mfstring"/>
        <def class="org.instantreality.InstantIO.Vec2f" code="sfvec2f"/>
        </codes>

        Type names are case sensitive. XIO codes are not case sensitive.

        Use this only, if the default values are not sufficient. See initialization methods for default values.

        Parameters:
        filename - Name of a XML file with XIO code definitions

      • getXioCodesFilename

        public static java.lang.String getXioCodesFilename()
        Returns the name of the file used for the mapping of XIO codes and types. See the setXioCodesFilename for more details.
        Returns:
        Name of the file with XIO code definitions

      • setSendInitValue

        public static void setSendInitValue(boolean sendInitializationValue)
        Defines if an initialization value should be send for a new created out-slot.
        If set to true, every time a new out-slot is created, venice.lib will send a value. This helps to have all slots be ready, when the real data comes in.
        Parameters:
        sendInitializationValue - true if initialization values have to be used, false otherwise
